Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: -alertControllerWillAppear:
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: Sent to the delegate just before the view controller appears.

Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: -alertControllerDidAppear:
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: Sent to teh delegate just after the view controller appears.

Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: -alertControllerWillDisappear:
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: Sent to the delegate just before the view controller disappears.

Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: -alertControllerDidDisappear:
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: Sent to teh delegate just after the view controller disappears.

Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: -alertController:didSelectAction:
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: Sent to the delegate when the user taps on an action. Message is sent before the action block is executed.

Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.name: VSAlertControllerDelegate
Protocols/VSAlertControllerDelegate.html.abstract: VSAlertControllerDelegate is a protocol used to inform an object about user intractions with alerts

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleRise
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert rises from the bottom of the screen and falls down when dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleFall
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert falls from the top of the screen and rises up when dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleSlide
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert slides from the left of the screen and slides to the right when dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleFlip
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert flips from the right, and flips to the left when dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleSticker
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert page flips from the top, then again from the bottom when dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleCrossDisolve
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert page fades in, then fades out dismissed.

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleAutomatic
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: The alert chooses its presentation and dismissal styles automatically.

Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.name: VSAlertControllerStyleAlert
Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.abstract: A standard alert, 270pt wide, variable height. Supports text fields

Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.name: VSAlertControllerStyleWalkthroughAlert
Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.abstract: A wider alert that stretches to the margins of the device - 18pt in either direction. Supports text fields, useful for onboarding. 500pt wide on iPad.

Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.name: VSAlertControllerStyleActionSheet
Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html#/c:@E@.abstract: An alert that appears at the bottom of the display, similar to Apple’s action sheet stlye. Does NOT support text fields.

Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html#/c:@E@VSAl.name: VSAlertActionStyleCancel
Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html#/c:@E@VSAl.abstract: An action that indicates to the user that the current process wil be cancelled

Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html#/c:@E@VSAl.name: VSAlertActionStyleDestructive
Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html#/c:@E@VSAl.abstract: An action indicates to the user that an irreversible process is about to happen.

Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html.name: VSAlertActionStyle
Enums/VSAlertActionStyle.html.abstract: An enumeration for the kinds of actions that can be created

Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html.name: VSAlertControllerStyle
Enums/VSAlertControllerStyle.html.abstract: An enumeration describing the kinds of alerts that VSAlertController can display

Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.name: VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle
Enums/VSAlertControllerAnimationStyle.ht.abstract: An enumeration describing the kinds of animations that can be used to present and hide an alert

Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerNotI.name: VSAlertControllerNotImplementedException
Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerNotI.abstract: An exception thrown when an unimplemented feature is encountered at runtime.

Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerText.name: VSAlertControllerTextFieldInvalidException
Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerText.abstract: An exception thrown when a text field is added to an alert controller which doesn’t support text fields

Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerPres.name: VSAlertControllerPresentationAnimationException
Constants.html#/c:@VSAlertControllerPres.abstract: An exception thrown when a view controller presentation animation fails

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: +alertControllerWithTitle:message:image:style:
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: A factory method to create an instance of VSAlertController. This is the preffered way to instantiate alerts

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: +alertControllerWithTitle:message:style:
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: A factory method to create an instance of VSAlertController.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: alertTitleTextColor
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The color of the alert title. The default value is black.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: alertMessageTextColor
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The color of the alert message (description). The default value is black.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: alertTitleTextFont
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The font of the alert title. The default value is the system font size 17 weight medium.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: alertMessageTextFont
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The font of the alert message (description). The default value is the system font size 15 weight regular.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: alertMessageTextAlignment
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The text alignment of the alert message

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: -addTextField:
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Add a text field to the alert. Rather than instantiating a UITextField object yourself, VSAlertController instantiates one for you. You can configure it using the optional configuration block

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: dismissOnBackgroundTap
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Set to YES if you want the alert to dismiss itself when the user taps on the background of the alert. Default is NO.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: animationStyle
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Change the animation used when the alert is presented AND dismissed. Default is VSAlertControllerAnimationStyleRise.

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: delegate
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: The delegate object to handle alert action interactions

Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.name: textFields
Classes/VSAlertController.html#/c:objc(c.abstract: Returns the array of text field objects that are displayed in the alert, so you can interact with the user’s inputs.

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: +alertActionWithTitle:style:action:
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: A factory method to create an instance of UIAlertAction. This is the prefered way to create alert actions.

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: actionTextColor
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: The color of the title text used in non-desctructive actions

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: destructiveActionTextColor
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: The color of the title text used in destructive actions

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: actionTextFont
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: The font of the title used in non-cancel actions

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: cancelActionTextFont
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: The font of the title used in cancel actions

Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.name: action
Classes/VSAlertAction.html#/c:objc(cs)VS.abstract: The block that will be executed when the user interacts with the action. The block is called on the main thread always, and begins executed before the alert is dismissed

Classes/VSAlertAction.html.name: VSAlertAction
Classes/VSAlertAction.html.abstract: VSAlertAction is a specialized subclass of UIButton that is used to populate and provide interactive controls to an instance of VSAlertController.

Classes/VSAlertController.html.name: VSAlertController
Classes/VSAlertController.html.abstract: VSAlertController is a drop-in replacement for UIAlertController with more features. It is created using the +alertControllerWithTitle:message:image:style: class method, and configured using instances of VSAlertAction. You can add text fields by calling -addTextField: on an instance of VSAlertController. Instantiate the controller, add your actions and textfieds. and any other configuration you might need. Present the controller modally using UIViewController’s -presentViewController:animated:completion: method. VSAlertController respects the animation paramater of this call, and you configure the animation in question by setting your instances animationStyle property before presentation. You can also change this property in the handler of an action to use a different animation on dismissal.
